title: Bug 113047: No children node listing when changing data source for a data set in data set editor page of the query tab
OB: When changing the data source for a data set in the data set editor page of the query tab, there is no listing of children nodes.
EB: When changing the data source for a data set, the new data source's children should be listed out.
SR:
To reproduce:
1. Create a new data set without a SQL statement.
2. Ensure that the new data source does not have any database/table/column information.
3. Change the data source for the data set.
4. Observe that there is no listing of children nodes.
5. Close the data set editor and reopen it to see if the issue persists.
